title: PHPfile_exists()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPfile_exists()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Check whether a file exists:
<?php
echo file_exists("webdictionary.txt");
?>
Run Example »
Definition and Usage
The file_exists() function checks whether a file or directory exists.
Note:
The result of this function is cached. Use
clearstatcache()
to 
clear the cache.
Syntax
file_exists(
path
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
path
Required. Specifies the path to the file or directory to check
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE if the file or directory exists, FALSE 
 on failure
PHP Version:
4.0+

★
+1
